main event: On June 12, 1966, three witnesses observed a star-like object in Beavercreek, Ohio for over 30 minutes.
interesting points: The object appeared stationary but changed to a reddish color, prompting the observer to call the Duty Officer., The observer described the object as looking like a star but had never seen such a red star before., The sighting lasted for more than 30 minutes, with consistent visibility., The conclusion from the investigation categorized the object as a celestial body (likely Venus)., No physical evidence or photographs were present.
sighted object: a star-like object that changed color
